{"4cd4ebef-0bab-4859-9109-a56a9dba80be":{"id":"4cd4ebef-0bab-4859-9109-a56a9dba80be","name":"React Hydration Mismatch in Body Class","timestamp":1762187174190,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
<additional_data>
Below are some potentially helpful/relevant pieces of information for figuring out to respond
<current_file>
```textmate:app/layout.tsx, lines=ALL(1-37)
import type { Metadata } from "next";
import { Poppins } from "next/font/google";
import "./globals.css";
import { AuthProvider } from "@/contexts/AuthContext";

const poppins = Poppins({
 variable: "--font-poppins",
 subsets: ["latin"],
 weight: ["300", "400", "500", "600", "700"],
});

export const metadata: Metadata = {
 title: "SikshaFlow - Reimagining Education, The Smarter Way",
 description: "A smart education management platform designed to fix inefficiencies in the university system. Streamline assignments, attendance, learning analytics, and more.",
 icons: {
 icon: "/favicon.ico",
 },
};

export default function RootLayout({
 children,
}: Readonly<{
 children: React.ReactNode;
}>) {
 return (
 <html lang="en" className="scroll-smooth">
 <body
 className={`${poppins.variable} antialiased`}
 >
 <AuthProvider>
 {children}
 </AuthProvider>
 </body>
 </html>
 );
}

```
</current_file>
</additional_data>
<user_query>
## Error Type
Console Error

## Error Message
A tree hydrated but some attributes of the server rendered HTML didn't match the client properties. This won't be patched up. This can happen if a SSR-ed Client Component used:

- A server/client branch `if (typeof window !== 'undefined')`.
- Variable input such as `Date.now()` or `Math.random()` which changes each time it's called.
- Date formatting in a user's locale which doesn't match the server.
- External changing data without sending a snapshot of it along with the HTML.
- Invalid HTML tag nesting.

It can also happen if the client has a browser extension installed which messes with the HTML before React loaded.

https://react.dev/link/hydration-mismatch

 ...

 <body

- __processed_14c12399-a580-4f90-bf72-b77af17b6bdc__="true"

 ...

Next.js version: 16.0.1 (Turbopack)


fix the error
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The error is caused by a browser extension (likely a password manager or form filler) injecting attributes into the `<body>` tag during client-side hydration, which causes a mismatch with the server-rendered HTML.

The solution is to suppress hydration warnings for the `<body>` tag by adding the `suppressHydrationWarning` prop:"}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_018UL2vaM35WynUDwXDimPvb","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"target_file": "app/layout.tsx", "instructions": "Add suppressHydrationWarning prop to the body tag to prevent hydration mismatch errors caused by browser extensions.", "code_edit": "import type { Metadata } from \"next\";\nimport { Poppins } from \"next/font/google\";\nimport \"./globals.css\";\nimport { AuthProvider } from \"@/contexts/AuthContext\";\n\nconst poppins = Poppins({\n variable: \"--font-poppins\",\n subsets: [\"latin\"],\n weight: [\"300\", \"400\", \"500\", \"600\", \"700\"],\n});\n\nexport const metadata: Metadata = {\n title: \"SikshaFlow - Reimagining Education, The Smarter Way\",\n description: \"A smart education management platform designed to fix inefficiencies in the university system. Streamline assignments, attendance, learning analytics, and more.\",\n icons: {\n icon: \"/favicon.ico\",\n },\n};\n\nexport default function RootLayout({\n children,\n}: Readonly<{\n children: React.ReactNode;\n}>) {\n return (\n <html lang=\"en\" className=\"scroll-smooth\">\n <body\n className={`${poppins.variable} antialiased`}\n suppressHydrationWarning\n >\n <AuthProvider>\n {children}\n </AuthProvider>\n </body>\n </html>\n );\n}\n"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_018UL2vaM35WynUDwXDimPvb","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -27,4 +27,5 @@
 <body
 className={`${poppins.variable} antialiased`}
+ suppressHydrationWarning
 >
 <AuthProvider>
```

The edit was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The error has been fixed! I added the `suppressHydrationWarning` prop to the `<body>` tag. This tells React to ignore hydration mismatches for that element.

**What was causing the error:**
Browser extensions (like password managers, form fillers, etc.) often inject attributes into the `<body>` tag. In your case, the extension was adding attributes like `__processed_14c12399-a580-4f90-bf72-b77af17b6bdc__` and `bis_register`. Since these attributes are added only on the client side and not during server-side rendering, React detected a mismatch during hydration.

**Why this solution works:**
The `suppressHydrationWarning` prop tells React to ignore attribute differences between the server-rendered HTML and the client-side DOM for that specific element. This is safe to use on the `<body>` tag since browser extensions commonly modify it, and these modifications don't affect your app's functionality."}]}]}}
